title:
Master equation-based model for infrared-based magnetometry with
  nitrogen-vacancy centers in diamond cavities: a path to sub-picotesla
  sensitivity at sub-millimeter scales
authors:
Hadi Zadeh-Haghighi and Omid Golami and Vinaya Kumar Kavatamane and
  Paul E. Barclay and Christoph Simon
abstract:
Our study aims to increase the spatial resolution of high-sensitivity
magnetometry based on singlet-transition infrared (IR) absorption using
nitrogen-vacancy (NV) centers in diamonds in monolithic cavities, with
potential applications in bio-magnetic field detection. We develop a
master-equation treatment of optically detected magnetic resonance,
incorporating IR light saturation effects. This master equation provides the
singlet population, which is then utilized to calculate the reflectivity and
ultimately derive the magnetic field sensitivity taking into account photon and
spin shot noise. We further show that our model is compatible with experiments
of IR-based NV center magnetometry. Through optimization in a high-parameter
space, we uncover the potential to achieve sensitivities in the order of
sub-pico tesla, even for sub-millimeter scales.
